p: In logistic regression analyses (Table 2), each year of heavy rainfall was associated with 1.14 (95% CI, 1.11-1.18) higher odds of prevalent HIV infection and 1.11 (95% CI, 1.07-1.15) higher odds of STIs in the past 12 months. We found evidence of an association between heavy rainfall and the respondent’s reported number of sexual partners (incidence rate ratio, 1.12; 95% CI, 1.10-1.15). Figure 1, Figure 2, and Figure 3 show the estimates for the associations between heavy rainfall and the 3 outcomes of interest for each country individually. Subgroup analyses for participants aged 15 to 24 years are shown in eFigures 1-3 in the Supplement.
